raw_response:
{
  "debt_incurrence": "General incurrence test: Company/Restricted Subsidiaries may incur Indebtedness if, after giving Pro Forma Effect, Senior Leverage Ratio <= 3.50x.  Key permitted debt/baskets (non-exhaustive, as shown in extracted sections): (i) Credit Facilities (incl. LCs/bankers’ acceptances) up to (x) $2,250.0mm + (y) the greater of (i) $700.0mm minus aggregate principal amount of Notes issued on Issue Date and (ii) 75% of Consolidated EBITDA for the Test Period then ended + (z) additional amount such that, after Pro Forma Effect to such additional incurrence and use of proceeds, First Lien Leverage Ratio <= 3.00x (and for clause (i)(z) sizing, all debt incurred under this clause (i) is deemed included in clause (a) of “First Lien Leverage Ratio”).  (ii) Notes (excluding Additional Notes).  (iii) Existing/Issue Date debt and specified note/credit agreement debt (Odeon Credit Agreement; 2024 Subordinated Sterling Notes; 2024 Senior Unsecured Convertible Notes; 2025 Subordinated Notes; 2026 Subordinated Dollar Notes; 2027 Subordinated Notes).  (xxix) Junior-lien secured debt: secured bonds/notes/debentures or secured loans, each secured by Liens junior to Liens on Collateral securing the Secured Notes Obligations, sized so that after giving effect, Secured Leverage Ratio <= 6.00x, and holders/representative must become party to the First Lien/Second Lien Intercreditor Agreement.  (xv) General debt basket: greater of $400.0mm and 40% of Consolidated EBITDA for most recently ended Test Period (with refinancing aggregation mechanics referenced in the clause).  (viii) Acquired/assumed secured debt in permitted acquisitions/investments: sized so that after Pro Forma Effect to assumption and acquisition/investment, Secured Leverage Ratio <= 6.00x (and not incurred in contemplation of the acquisition/investment). ",
  "restricted_payments": "General RP test: Restricted Payments (dividends/distributions on Equity Interests; equity repurchases/redemptions; Restricted Investments) permitted only if, at time of and after giving effect: (A) no Event of Default under Section 6.01 is continuing for RPs under clauses (i) and (ii), except that for amounts attributable to the $300.0mm starter basket (subclause (1) of clause (B)) the no-EoD condition is limited to no EoD under Section 6.01(a), (b), (e) or (f); and (B) aggregate RPs after Issue Date do not exceed the sum of: (1) $300.0mm; (2) [reserved]; (3) (i) cumulative Consolidated EBITDA for each quarter from fiscal quarter beginning Jan 1, 2021 through most recently ended fiscal quarter minus (ii) 1.70x cumulative Consolidated Interest Expense for same period; plus (4) cash/Cash Equivalents returns/profits/distributions and FMV of in-kind returns on Investments made using the builder amount (capped at amount of such Investments); plus (5) Investments in Unrestricted Subsidiaries later redesignated/merged back (up to FMV at redesignation/merger); plus (6) Net Proceeds of sale/disposition of Unrestricted Subsidiary (incl. issuance/sale of its Equity Interests) received by Company/Restricted Subsidiary; plus (8) aggregate Retained Declined Proceeds since Issue Date (and additional components continue beyond the excerpt).  Additional RP capacity: Company may make additional Restricted Payments if, after giving effect on a Pro Forma Basis, Total Leverage Ratio <= 4.50x and no continuing Event of Default.  Timing: payment of any Restricted Payment (or consummation of irrevocable redemption/purchase/defeasance/other payment) within 60 days after declaration/irrevocable notice is permitted if it complied on the declaration/notice date. ",
  "asset_sales": "Asset sale conditions: (1) must be for Fair Market Value; and (2) except for a Permitted Asset Swap, a Sale Leaseback, or disposition of a Multiplex theatre, for any Asset Sale with purchase price > greater of $50.0mm and 5% of Consolidated EBITDA for most recently ended Test Period, at least 75% of consideration (together with all other Asset Sales completed/contractually agreed since Issue Date) must be cash or Cash Equivalents.  Reinvestment/application timing: within 450 days after receipt of Net Proceeds (the “Asset Sale Proceeds Application Period”), Company/Restricted Subsidiary may apply an amount equal to Net Proceeds (“Applicable Proceeds”) to: (1) if disposed assets were Collateral, repay Notes, Senior Credit Facilities, or Additional First Lien Obligations (and for revolving, reduce commitments); (2) if disposed assets were not Collateral, repay Notes/Senior Credit Facilities/Additional First Lien Obligations, or repay other Senior Indebtedness, but if repaying other Senior Indebtedness must either (A) reduce Notes ratably via redemption/open-market/privately negotiated purchases and/or (B) make an offer to all Holders to purchase Notes ratably for >=100% of principal plus accrued interest (deemed an Asset Sale Offer); (3) invest in the business (including permitted acquisitions/Investments); or (4) any combination.  Acceptable Commitment mechanic: for clause (3) investments, a binding commitment/LOI counts as application from commitment date if entered with good faith expectation to apply within 180 days after expiration of the 450-day period, and actually applied within that 180-day post-period window (the “Commitment Application Period”); if an Acceptable Commitment is later cancelled/terminated after the 450-day period and before application, Applicable Proceeds become Excess Proceeds unless Company/Restricted Subsidiary reasonably expects to enter another Acceptable Commitment prior to expiration of the 450-day period and applies within the Commitment Application Period.  Excess Proceeds / mandatory offer: amounts of Applicable Proceeds not applied within the time period become “Excess Proceeds” (with the proviso that amounts offered to Holders pursuant to the required offer mechanics are not deemed Excess Proceeds regardless of acceptance).  If aggregate Excess Proceeds exceeds $100.0mm, Company must within 20 Business Days make an offer to purchase Notes (and, if required/permitted, other First Lien Obligations and/or, if disposed assets were not Collateral, Pari Passu Indebtedness) using Excess Proceeds.  Offer mechanics: offer must remain open at least 20 Business Days; Purchase Date is no later than 5 Business Days after Offer Period ends; Company applies all Excess Proceeds (or Advance Portion) to purchase tendered Notes (and, if applicable, other covered debt) on a pro rata basis. ",
  "change_of_control": "Upon Change of Control, unless Company has redeemed all Notes, Company must make a Change of Control Offer to purchase all Notes at 101% of principal (or higher “Alternate Offer” price as Company determines) plus accrued and unpaid interest to purchase date (subject to record-date interest mechanics).  Notice/timing: within 60 days after Change of Control, Company must send notice to Holders; purchase date must be no earlier than 20 Business Days nor later than 60 days from date notice is sent (the “Change of Control Payment Date”), but may be delayed until conditions (if any) are satisfied/waived.  Tender/withdrawal mechanics (as stated in notice requirements): Holders must surrender Notes (or follow DTC procedures) by close of business on the third Business Day preceding the payment date; withdrawal permitted until close of business on the tenth Business Day after notice is sent (or later if Company extends) by delivering withdrawal notice per DTC procedures. ",
  "liens_and_other": "Liens (Section 4.07): Company/Restricted Subsidiaries may not create Liens (other than Permitted Liens) securing Indebtedness on any asset/property unless, for Initial Liens on assets/property that are not Collateral, the Notes are equally and ratably secured with (or, if the Lien relates to Junior Financing, secured on a senior basis to) the obligations so secured. Any Lien granted to secure the Notes under this covenant is automatically released when the related Initial Lien is released; if an Initial Lien becomes a Permitted Lien, Company may elect to release the Notes’ equal-and-ratable Lien without Holder consent.  Permitted Liens include (illustrative items from the extracted list): Liens securing debt permitted under the Credit Facilities basket; Permitted Encumbrances; certain Issue Date Liens (with limitations on extension to additional property); purchase money/capital lease Liens that attach concurrently with or within 270 days of acquisition/repair/replacement/construction/improvement and only encumber financed property (plus accessions/proceeds, etc.); and numerous other enumerated categories.  Negative Pledge (Section 4.09): Company/Restricted Subsidiaries may not enter into agreements that prohibit/limit ability of Company or any Guarantor to create Liens on their properties/revenues for benefit of Holders with respect to Secured Notes Obligations, subject to enumerated exceptions (e.g., Requirements of Law; documentation governing Indebtedness under Section 4.05(b)(i); this Indenture; Security Documents; and other listed categories).  Future Guarantors (Section 4.10): after Issue Date, any Restricted Subsidiary that guarantees (a) Senior Credit Facilities, (b) Existing Notes, (c) any Credit Facility incurred under Section 4.05(b)(i) in aggregate principal amount > $250.0mm, or (d) any other capital markets debt securities of Company or any Guarantor in aggregate principal amount > $250.0mm must become a Guarantor of the Notes and join intercreditor/security documents within 60 days of guaranteeing such other Indebtedness (with guarantee limited by fraudulent transfer considerations). ",
  "reasoning_steps": [
    "Step 1: Located the covenant sections by using the indenture’s table of contents to identify the relevant sections (4.05, 4.06, 4.07–4.11, 4.16) and then pulled the corresponding text excerpts for each section from input.pdf. ",
    "Step 2: Extracted the operative tests and mechanics by capturing (i) the stated leverage ratio thresholds (e.g., Senior Leverage Ratio 3.50x; First Lien Leverage Ratio 3.00x; Secured Leverage Ratio 6.00x; Total Leverage Ratio 4.50x), (ii) fixed-dollar and “greater of” baskets (e.g., $2,250.0mm; greater of $700.0mm less Notes vs 75% EBITDA; $300.0mm RP starter; Excess Proceeds trigger $100.0mm; Asset Sale cash threshold greater of $50.0mm and 5% EBITDA), and (iii) timing requirements (e.g., 450-day reinvestment period; 180-day commitment application period; 20 Business Day offer periods; 60-day Change of Control notice; purchase date windows).     "
  ]
}

parsed_response.debt_incurrence: General incurrence test: Company/Restricted Subsidiaries may incur Indebtedness if, after giving Pro Forma Effect, Senior Leverage Ratio <= 3.50x.  Key permitted debt/baskets (non-exhaustive, as shown in extracted sections): (i) Credit Facilities (incl. LCs/bankers’ acceptances) up to (x) $2,250.0mm + (y) the greater of (i) $700.0mm minus aggregate principal amount of Notes issued on Issue Date and (ii) 75% of Consolidated EBITDA for the Test Period then ended + (z) additional amount such that, after Pro Forma Effect to such additional incurrence and use of proceeds, First Lien Leverage Ratio <= 3.00x (and for clause (i)(z) sizing, all debt incurred under this clause (i) is deemed included in clause (a) of “First Lien Leverage Ratio”).  (ii) Notes (excluding Additional Notes).  (iii) Existing/Issue Date debt and specified note/credit agreement debt (Odeon Credit Agreement; 2024 Subordinated Sterling Notes; 2024 Senior Unsecured Convertible Notes; 2025 Subordinated Notes; 2026 Subordinated Dollar Notes; 2027 Subordinated Notes).  (xxix) Junior-lien secured debt: secured bonds/notes/debentures or secured loans, each secured by Liens junior to Liens on Collateral securing the Secured Notes Obligations, sized so that after giving effect, Secured Leverage Ratio <= 6.00x, and holders/representative must become party to the First Lien/Second Lien Intercreditor Agreement.  (xv) General debt basket: greater of $400.0mm and 40% of Consolidated EBITDA for most recently ended Test Period (with refinancing aggregation mechanics referenced in the clause).  (viii) Acquired/assumed secured debt in permitted acquisitions/investments: sized so that after Pro Forma Effect to assumption and acquisition/investment, Secured Leverage Ratio <= 6.00x (and not incurred in contemplation of the acquisition/investment).
parsed_response.restricted_payments: General RP test: Restricted Payments (dividends/distributions on Equity Interests; equity repurchases/redemptions; Restricted Investments) permitted only if, at time of and after giving effect: (A) no Event of Default under Section 6.01 is continuing for RPs under clauses (i) and (ii), except that for amounts attributable to the $300.0mm starter basket (subclause (1) of clause (B)) the no-EoD condition is limited to no EoD under Section 6.01(a), (b), (e) or (f); and (B) aggregate RPs after Issue Date do not exceed the sum of: (1) $300.0mm; (2) [reserved]; (3) (i) cumulative Consolidated EBITDA for each quarter from fiscal quarter beginning Jan 1, 2021 through most recently ended fiscal quarter minus (ii) 1.70x cumulative Consolidated Interest Expense for same period; plus (4) cash/Cash Equivalents returns/profits/distributions and FMV of in-kind returns on Investments made using the builder amount (capped at amount of such Investments); plus (5) Investments in Unrestricted Subsidiaries later redesignated/merged back (up to FMV at redesignation/merger); plus (6) Net Proceeds of sale/disposition of Unrestricted Subsidiary (incl. issuance/sale of its Equity Interests) received by Company/Restricted Subsidiary; plus (8) aggregate Retained Declined Proceeds since Issue Date (and additional components continue beyond the excerpt).  Additional RP capacity: Company may make additional Restricted Payments if, after giving effect on a Pro Forma Basis, Total Leverage Ratio <= 4.50x and no continuing Event of Default.  Timing: payment of any Restricted Payment (or consummation of irrevocable redemption/purchase/defeasance/other payment) within 60 days after declaration/irrevocable notice is permitted if it complied on the declaration/notice date.
parsed_response.asset_sales: Asset sale conditions: (1) must be for Fair Market Value; and (2) except for a Permitted Asset Swap, a Sale Leaseback, or disposition of a Multiplex theatre, for any Asset Sale with purchase price > greater of $50.0mm and 5% of Consolidated EBITDA for most recently ended Test Period, at least 75% of consideration (together with all other Asset Sales completed/contractually agreed since Issue Date) must be cash or Cash Equivalents.  Reinvestment/application timing: within 450 days after receipt of Net Proceeds (the “Asset Sale Proceeds Application Period”), Company/Restricted Subsidiary may apply an amount equal to Net Proceeds (“Applicable Proceeds”) to: (1) if disposed assets were Collateral, repay Notes, Senior Credit Facilities, or Additional First Lien Obligations (and for revolving, reduce commitments); (2) if disposed assets were not Collateral, repay Notes/Senior Credit Facilities/Additional First Lien Obligations, or repay other Senior Indebtedness, but if repaying other Senior Indebtedness must either (A) reduce Notes ratably via redemption/open-market/privately negotiated purchases and/or (B) make an offer to all Holders to purchase Notes ratably for >=100% of principal plus accrued interest (deemed an Asset Sale Offer); (3) invest in the business (including permitted acquisitions/Investments); or (4) any combination.  Acceptable Commitment mechanic: for clause (3) investments, a binding commitment/LOI counts as application from commitment date if entered with good faith expectation to apply within 180 days after expiration of the 450-day period, and actually applied within that 180-day post-period window (the “Commitment Application Period”); if an Acceptable Commitment is later cancelled/terminated after the 450-day period and before application, Applicable Proceeds become Excess Proceeds unless Company/Restricted Subsidiary reasonably expects to enter another Acceptable Commitment prior to expiration of the 450-day period and applies within the Commitment Application Period.  Excess Proceeds / mandatory offer: amounts of Applicable Proceeds not applied within the time period become “Excess Proceeds” (with the proviso that amounts offered to Holders pursuant to the required offer mechanics are not deemed Excess Proceeds regardless of acceptance).  If aggregate Excess Proceeds exceeds $100.0mm, Company must within 20 Business Days make an offer to purchase Notes (and, if required/permitted, other First Lien Obligations and/or, if disposed assets were not Collateral, Pari Passu Indebtedness) using Excess Proceeds.  Offer mechanics: offer must remain open at least 20 Business Days; Purchase Date is no later than 5 Business Days after Offer Period ends; Company applies all Excess Proceeds (or Advance Portion) to purchase tendered Notes (and, if applicable, other covered debt) on a pro rata basis.
parsed_response.change_of_control: Upon Change of Control, unless Company has redeemed all Notes, Company must make a Change of Control Offer to purchase all Notes at 101% of principal (or higher “Alternate Offer” price as Company determines) plus accrued and unpaid interest to purchase date (subject to record-date interest mechanics).  Notice/timing: within 60 days after Change of Control, Company must send notice to Holders; purchase date must be no earlier than 20 Business Days nor later than 60 days from date notice is sent (the “Change of Control Payment Date”), but may be delayed until conditions (if any) are satisfied/waived.  Tender/withdrawal mechanics (as stated in notice requirements): Holders must surrender Notes (or follow DTC procedures) by close of business on the third Business Day preceding the payment date; withdrawal permitted until close of business on the tenth Business Day after notice is sent (or later if Company extends) by delivering withdrawal notice per DTC procedures.
parsed_response.liens_and_other: Liens (Section 4.07): Company/Restricted Subsidiaries may not create Liens (other than Permitted Liens) securing Indebtedness on any asset/property unless, for Initial Liens on assets/property that are not Collateral, the Notes are equally and ratably secured with (or, if the Lien relates to Junior Financing, secured on a senior basis to) the obligations so secured. Any Lien granted to secure the Notes under this covenant is automatically released when the related Initial Lien is released; if an Initial Lien becomes a Permitted Lien, Company may elect to release the Notes’ equal-and-ratable Lien without Holder consent.  Permitted Liens include (illustrative items from the extracted list): Liens securing debt permitted under the Credit Facilities basket; Permitted Encumbrances; certain Issue Date Liens (with limitations on extension to additional property); purchase money/capital lease Liens that attach concurrently with or within 270 days of acquisition/repair/replacement/construction/improvement and only encumber financed property (plus accessions/proceeds, etc.); and numerous other enumerated categories.  Negative Pledge (Section 4.09): Company/Restricted Subsidiaries may not enter into agreements that prohibit/limit ability of Company or any Guarantor to create Liens on their properties/revenues for benefit of Holders with respect to Secured Notes Obligations, subject to enumerated exceptions (e.g., Requirements of Law; documentation governing Indebtedness under Section 4.05(b)(i); this Indenture; Security Documents; and other listed categories).  Future Guarantors (Section 4.10): after Issue Date, any Restricted Subsidiary that guarantees (a) Senior Credit Facilities, (b) Existing Notes, (c) any Credit Facility incurred under Section 4.05(b)(i) in aggregate principal amount > $250.0mm, or (d) any other capital markets debt securities of Company or any Guarantor in aggregate principal amount > $250.0mm must become a Guarantor of the Notes and join intercreditor/security documents within 60 days of guaranteeing such other Indebtedness (with guarantee limited by fraudulent transfer considerations).
reasoning_steps: Step 1: Located the covenant sections by using the indenture’s table of contents to identify the relevant sections (4.05, 4.06, 4.07–4.11, 4.16) and then pulled the corresponding text excerpts for each section from input.pdf.

Step 2: Extracted the operative tests and mechanics by capturing (i) the stated leverage ratio thresholds (e.g., Senior Leverage Ratio 3.50x; First Lien Leverage Ratio 3.00x; Secured Leverage Ratio 6.00x; Total Leverage Ratio 4.50x), (ii) fixed-dollar and “greater of” baskets (e.g., $2,250.0mm; greater of $700.0mm less Notes vs 75% EBITDA; $300.0mm RP starter; Excess Proceeds trigger $100.0mm; Asset Sale cash threshold greater of $50.0mm and 5% EBITDA), and (iii) timing requirements (e.g., 450-day reinvestment period; 180-day commitment application period; 20 Business Day offer periods; 60-day Change of Control notice; purchase date windows).
